page.title: 09THE KENILWORTH BYPASS
page.content: This was built in the early 1970's as a link between Warwick and Coventry. Its construction caused a major impact on the largely rural surroudings. G.R. 320735 - 344760. It intersects with the Stonebridge Highway which runs w-e across the northern part of the area. Opposition was based on loss of farm land and noise pollution.The route passed through Coventry Golf Course land and directly through the clubhouse!This is now re-located N.E. of its former site.Noise from the road is the main problem and houses in Finham have been given double glazing grants to alleviate this problem.Noise is considerable even some distance away on King's Hill.Local tradespeople such as Russell's and Smith's nurseries report a marked reduction in passing trade.
